page.title: 04COLLIER STREET FETE.
page.content: On the 8th.June 1985 we visited a fete at Claygate,Collier Street.The warm weather which melted the ice cream attracted 400 people.There were a number of stalls including rifle range, doughnuts,tombola,death ride and raffle tickets.The latter were sold at a pound each which we thought was a high price but the prize was a holiday for two in Brighton.There was a "penny roll"stall and a Guide stall celebrating 75 years of Guiding.The funds from the fete were going towards the church which was burnt in January.870 pounds was raised and this was made up to 1,000 pounds by an anonymous donor after the church service the following Sunday.Last year the fete was much larger with helicopters and fairground rides but this did not make much profit even though 7,000 people went.
